comments.body: Probably explained in code later, but want to leave the comment here in case I forget... do you ever compact an in progress file? That sounds dangerous.

We prevent such situation via restriction on configuration; max file to retain cannot be set to 0 which means we will don't try to compact the last file which might be in progress file.

Actually allowing to set it to 0 is bad for completed log as well, as you may lose everything on compaction - most of the cases all jobs should be finished.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +174,178 @@  override def fileSizeForLastIndex: Long = status.getLen

  override def completed: Boolean = !rootPath.getName.stripSuffix(EventLogFileWriter.COMPACTED)
    .endsWith(EventLogFileWriter.IN_PROGRESS)
